page.title: 16EAST OGWELL CHURCH
page.content:
Kelly's Directory of Devon for 1926 says:{"The church of St.Bartholemew is {a building of mixed styles and various {dates,consisting of Chancel, Nave, {Aisles, South Porch and an embattled {western Tower containing five bells." The church is peaceful and very pretty inside.It is usually decorated with flowers.The only sound is the birds outside, except when the Rector, Rev.Geoffry Watts is taking a service. I am a member of the church choir. There are twelve of us, both boys and girls, and we sing at the morning service every Sunday. We have Choir Practice on Friday evenings. We usually sing hymns and psalms but sometimes we learn special anthems.
Tania Bailey. Age 11
